item.title: My first communication, via LinkedIn, to Donald Alway, Assistant Director in Charge of the Los Angeles FBI Field Office
item.description: Click this link to see the original LinkedIn post. From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Date sent: May 29, 2023, 08:50 (Beijing time) To: Donald Alway (Assistant Director in Charge, FBI) Dear Mr. Don Alway, thank you for sharing the message of Director Wray. I watched it with genuine interest. I sincerely hope the FBI doesn’t underestimate the harm done by white-collar criminals. Director Wray omitted to mention financial crime but financial crimes often end up causing very significant harm to society including lots of premature deaths.

item.title: Email to Adam Rogalski. Special Agent in Charge? FBI case number? FBI Victim Specialist?
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Special Agent in Charge? FBI case number? FBI Victim Specialist? Date sent：2023-01-27 17:32 (Beijing time +0800) To: Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department) Cc: Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist), Edward Lehman, and many more people (I will try to update this section soon) My reference for this case: USA-v-McDonalds-pattern-of-racketeering-activity Dear Mr. Rogalski, As a victim of the transnational criminal enterprise orchestrated by the criminal entity McDonald’s Corporation, I would like to ask you three questions:

item.title: Email sent on 2022-12-29 to the F.B.I. to ask who is the case agent in charge of the case targeting McDonald’s Corporation.
item.description:
From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

To: [Mr. Manjarrez’s username]@fbi.gov

Cc: Edward Lehman, Muyi Xiao (NYTimes), Kevin Granville (Business Editor at NYTimes), Constant Méheut (NYTimes), David Enrich (NYTimes), Michael Forsythe (NYTimes)

Bcc: Yves Strickler (French law professor)

Subject: Who is the case agent in charge of the criminal investigation?

Date sent: 2022-12-29 at 01:17 Beijing time (+0800)

item.title: Undeliverable Email Notification received on 2022-12-28 from postmaster@state.gov.
item.description:
From: postmaster@state.gov

To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

Subject: Undeliverable: NEW REFERENCE: USA-v-McDonalds-pattern-of-racketeering-activity

Date received: 2022-12-28 at 14:53 Beijing time (+0800)

On 2022-12-28, I sent an email to the F.B.I.

To: [Mr. Rogalski’s username]@state.gov, [Mr. Manjarrez’s username]@fbi.gov

Cc: Edward Lehman, Muyi Xiao (NYTimes), Kevin Granville (Business Editor at NYTimes), Constant Méheut (NYTimes), David Enrich (NYTimes), Michael Forsythe (NYTimes)

Bcc: Yves Strickler (French law professor)

Subject: NEW REFERENCE: USA-v-McDonalds-pattern-of-racketeering-activity

Date sent: 2022-12-28 at 14:49 Beijing time (+0800)

item.title: Sending the F.B.I. my reference for the case targeting McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering + additional warnings
item.description:
On 2022-04-28, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to give them my reference for the case targeting the transnational criminal enterprise McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering.

I am also reminding the F.B.I. that the law firm representing McDonald’s France was Péchenard & Associés, a law firm which belongs to and/or used to belong to the parents of the former General Director of the French National Police.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department)

SUBJECT: Case number McDonald’s

item.title: Sending the F.B.I. my reference for the case targeting McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering + additional warnings
item.description:
On 2022-04-28, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to give them my reference for the case targeting the transnational criminal enterprise McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering.

I am also reminding the F.B.I. that the law firm representing McDonald’s France was Péchenard & Associés, a law firm which belongs to and/or used to belong to the parents of the former General Director of the French National Police.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist)

SUBJECT: Case number McDonald’s

item.title: Whistle-blower asking the F.B.I. if they received and kept the emails which were sent in 2015 and if they ever launched a criminal investigation against McDonald’s Corporation
item.description:
On 2022-04-20, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to ask them if they ever received the emails I sent them back in 2015 regarding the major case targeting McDonald’s Corporation.

I also ask the F.B.I. if they ever launched a criminal investigation targeting the transnational criminal enterprise.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department), Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist)

SUBJECT: Has the FBI ever received the emails I sent in 2015?

item.title: Hunger Strike. Reply from French Law Professor Yves Strickler
item.description: Note: this email has been redacted for brevity. Check the French version of this page for the full content. Key point: French law professor Yves Strickler didn’t disapprove the possibility for me to do a hunger strike to protest the repeated violations of my fundamental rights by France. For the record, I am now accusing McDonald’s of having corrupted French officials. It might help to explain why McDonald’s France and McDonald’s Corporation, and their accomplices, have never been indicted for serious fraud and money laundering in France.

item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald’s General Counsel CCed to McDonald’s CEO
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: additional frauds Date sent: 2015-10-22 11:06 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: 4th formal notice sent to the executives of McDonald’s Corporation to keep warning them that McDonald’s France has engaged in a pattern of racketeering activity
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Translation of yesterday’s email Date sent: October 21, 2015, 12:01 (Beijing time) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook, Robert Gibbs (Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com), Silvia Lagnado (Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com), Kevin Ozan <Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com>, Jim Sappington (Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com), Mike Andres <Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com> PLEASE FIND HERE THE TRANSLATION OF THE EMAIL I SENT YOU YESTERDAY. Mesdames, Messieurs, Dear Sir or Madam, Je vous ordonne de faire cesser immédiatement votre escroquerie en bande organisée visant les mineurs que constitue la fraude McDonald’s Monopoly.

item.title: “I sold my soul to McDonald’s”
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France, and later in Europe. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:

item.title: Françoise de Borda, former general counsel of McDonald’s France
item.description:
Via certified mail with proof of receipt requested

From: Françoise de Borda (Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

If I recall correctly, a copy of the mail was sent to a French Ministerial Officer who I now accuse of being corrupted.

Translation coming soon. (Note of 2023-04-13: quick note, this event happened in 2012 and I published it, if I am not mistaken, on 2022-09-21T20:49:00+08:00. Back then I wrote “translation coming soon” but I currently don’t have time to translate what was said in French. It’s an important event but not that important compared to what I am currently explaining to the FBI which is the priority.)

Françoise de Borda, directrice juridique de McDonald’s France, me réponds pour la première et pour la dernière fois. Elle ment.
